item.text: Alas, all good things must come to an end. Farewell, America. We'll miss ya! — Hoofy & Boo
There’s nothing easy about saying goodbye, America. That’s why I like to sound it out nice and slowly: Goooood-byyyye! — Boo

If the wonderful folks at our sponsor, BlackBerry, think I’m returning my Z10 to them, they’ve got another thing coming. Seriously. I shipped them back a box full of rocks. By the time they figure things out, my phone and I will be halfway to sunny Guadalajara. — Hoofy
Well, America, our six-part news series is winding down. We've laughed, we've cried, we've even seen the world's largest falafel. Take a few minutes to look back and reminisce fondly. — Boo
Yesterday's Nasdaq shutdown has led many to worry about how vulnerable our dependency on all-things-digital leaves us. To those folks I say, choose your devices wisely. — Hoofy

During my cross-country travels, I spent some time in Hawaii with a research scientist who has successfully made bunny rabbits glow in the dark. I kept wondering why he insisted on cooking me a turkey dinner each night and was always quick to fill my glass with red wine before letting me fall asleep on his living room couch. Now I get it. — Boo
A study has found that workers spend the equivalent of 73 full work days dealing with email annually. Using BlackBerry Hub on my Q10 all summer, I've shaved my yearly average down to 62. — Hoofy
One highlight of my trip? While reporting on how US pawn shops have become competitors to luxury handbag dealers, I was able to pick up a few pieces for my collection on the cheap. — Boo

Now that Boo's back, we can quit our daily BBM Video chats. But then again, is there really any point in talking to someone if you can't share what you're both looking at on your smartphone screens? — Hoofy
After a summer covering financial news across the US, I've finally rejoined Hoofy at our global headquarters. This week, we sit down, kick back, and talk about what we've all learned. — Boo

I just had a quick BBM Video Call with Boo to discuss the latest segment of "Financial News on the Move". Tune in Monday for what we’re both anticipating will be our most compelling report yet when we tackle the huge business of Big Data. — Hoofy

It’s hunting season in Deer Trail, Colorado, where a proposed ordinance will permit residents to shoot down drones flying under 1,000 feet with a 12-gauge shotgun. This year's hottest taxidermic wall piece? An MQ-1 Predator. — Boo

"Quantum Dawn 2" is upon us! The Securities and Industrial Financial Markets Association is conducting a cyberattack drill tomorrow to test the cyber security chops of around 50 banks and US government agencies. Think you're so tough, SIFMA? Show me what you've got. — Hoofy

Rich tastes start early in America. A 14-month-old girl in Portland, Oregon recently purchased a 1962 Austin Healey Sprite while using her father’s smartphone. When asked for a comment on what some might call a frivolous purchase, the girl spittled then laughed at me. Whew, young money’s as arrogant as ever. — Boo

I imagine Bernanke woke up feeling like a boss today after last month’s producer price index beat forecasts. 200 push-ups, 50 laps, and a raw egg protein shake. Suits up and out the door. Straight ballin’. — Hoofy

In commodities news, the high cost of helium is taking its toll on the average American. A Bend, Oregon man famous for flying a lawn chair rigged with party balloons has been forced to ground his endeavors. When asked how the price pleasure made him feel, he told me “deflated”. — Boo
Fed minutes are out today. Bernanke speaks after the close. I get chills thinking about what that bald, bearded beauty is going to say. — Hoofy

Cops are on the lookout for two crooks who stole 400 fish from a koi pond in Fairfax, VA. Why exactly did I get pulled over and dragged down to a local precinct for questioning? Can you say ‘profiling’? — Boo
Happy belated birthday, America! If you’re anything like me, you’ll be working remotely on this slow summer Friday. Good thing I’ve got the best to keep me plugged in. — Hoofy

It wouldn’t be our nation’s birthday without a few illegal fireworks busts. I’m on the scene in West Haven, Connecticut where three men have been arrested for selling more than just snakes and silver sparklers. Let’s take a moment to remember fireworks are not toys, America. They just look like them. — Boo
New market trends show consumers are favoring smaller tablet computers, while at the same time sales of larger PCs are on the rise. What about smartphones? Well, the good ones fit just right. — Hoofy
Time for a little fun in the sun at the Jersey Shore. I'll be looking juiced and tan come Monday morning. Aww yeah. — Boo

What could possibly be better than Boo's report on the Japanese economy? I'll give you a hint: it's got a full keyboard and the ability to seamlessly share screens during BBM video calls. That kind of gave it away, didn't it? — Hoofy
Check out my latest in-depth report on Japan's troubled economy, delivered straight from...well, um, just off I-287 in New Jersey. — Boo
Heads up, America. A brand new report drops tomorrow, and it's smoking hot. — Hoofy

A man in Fairfax, Virginia is currently selling a suit of chainmail armor for $24,400. Oh wait, did I forget to mention it’s for a guinea pig! Who said American small business was on the decline? — Boo

A closely watched Fed announcement, shocking revelations about our national security practices, and Treasury Secretary Jack Lew's new signature! Boy, there's been a lot of news to keep track of this week. Thankfully, I've got my Q10 to help me keep things nice and organized. — Hoofy

I'm in Boston where a woman just paid $560,000 for two parking spots near her Back Bay home. Forget about this month's stronger-than-expected homebuilder confidence index; I'm using my savings to buy an empty lot, some white paint, and sign that says “an attendant will be with you shortly”. — Boo
Wall Street's buckling in ahead of tomorrow's FOMC gathering. It's zero-hour, America. Are you ready? — Hoofy
I'm in need of some serious unwinding after Hoofy botched yet another report. Heading out to Montauk for a chilled lobster tail and some gnarly waves. Catch you later, people. — Boo

While some are beginning to believe a new housing bubble has emerged, I can't help but reminisce about better times, when every American had a stretch of land to call home, a fully paid mortgage, and a BlacBerry in their pocket. Why can't we make 2013 look a little more like 1998? — Hoofy
Is the Fed about to send its controversial QE policy packing? I'm on the scene in the Big Apple to find out. — Boo

It's Monday morning and I'm jazzed. No, not because of the new Euro-Zone Sentix Investor Confidence Survey numbers. I can take or leave those. It's the latest segment in our Financial News on the Move series that I can't live without. — Hoofy
Just arrived in New York City for my next big story. Check back this Monday for a revelatory report on what many believe could be an end to the Fed's controversial quantitative easing policy. — Boo
The past few trading sessions have reminded us that great things can't last forever. Even my BlackBerry Z10 will run out of juice eventually. — Hoofy

I'm in New Hampshire, where a mother and daughter team have launched a line of diapers for chickens. They're the latest to capitalize on the growing ‘backyard chicken movement,' which seeks to move farm fowl out of the coop and into suburban homes. Only in America, people. — Boo

Some smartphone manufacturers are researching the use of electronic tattoos and digestible ECG pills to ensure handset security. Well, until they come out with a cherry-flavored chewable, I'll stick with my BlackBerry Z10's market-leading security features. — Hoofy

Checking in from Colorado, where a new climate change czar position has just been signed into law. Way to lead the progressive fight, CO. Maybe now you'll think about reviewing some of your more archaic laws, like how it's still legal to hunt bears. — Boo

Has the 30-year secular bull market in bonds finally come to an end? Only time will tell, America. Speaking of time, has anyone checked out the new BlackBerry Camera with Time Shift? Oh boy, if they could only modify this thing for stock charts... — Hoofy

As a bear, I've been blessed with one of the best senses of smell in the animal kingdom. Unfortunately, that makes the stench of patchouli even more unbearable. It's been fun San Francisco, but I'm outta here. Time for some fresh mountain air. — Boo

Despite the rise of so-called ‘cybercities' like New York, Hong Kong, Tel Aviv and London, Silicon Valley still remains the technology capital of the world. Say what you want, America, but my heart will always belong to Waterloo. — Hoofy

With my report on tech innovation in the bag, I'm set to unplug for the holiday weekend. Just pulled into Haight Ashbury, where I'm crashing with some friends I met while working on that communal farm back in ‘71. — Boo

The next installment in our nationwide news series has landed. Boo joins us live from Silicon Valley where he's uncovered what the future of tech could look like. But to be honest, America, I think the future is already here...and I'm holding it in my hoof. — Hoofy

Think a smartphone case with a detachable cup holder is as good as it gets? Then be sure to tune in tomorrow, when I join Hoofy from Silicon Valley to discuss how disruptive innovation is pushing the boundaries of what we should expect from tech. — Boo

A new poll says two-thirds of business professionals who've switched from BlackBerry to other smartphones have been tempted to switch back to the new Q10. Give in people, it feels soooo right. — Hoofy
Get this, a study just released says people in Ohio curse more than anywhere else in the US. I just drove through Cleveland and I can tell you that's &%!#@?$ nonsense. — Boo

Recently, some psychoanalysts have labelled the intense bond many people have with their smartphones as the same kind of love we feel toward family members and even romantic partners. Listen America, what happens between a talking cartoon bull and his brand-new BlackBerry Z10 behind closed doors is frankly nobody else's business but their own. — Hoofy
Dan Rather once called journalism more addicting than cigarettes. Well, I just smoked a pack. Now I'm looking for a story. — Boo

Last night I dreamt of a new world. A world where keyboards learned how you typed; where conversations and emails were always a single swipe away; where people everywhere took a cue from other cultures and started treating we bovine with a little more respect. It was beautiful, America. Simply beautiful... — Hoofy

What's the most valuable thing I've learned while in DC this past week? When a first-term congresswoman challenges you to a tequila shot contest after you've snuck into the secret members-only room beneath Charlie Palmer's Steakhouse, just say no. — Boo
While Boo wastes the rest of his week traipsing around the Washington Mall, I'm getting cozy with my new BlackBerry Z10. Champagne, a candlelight dinner...maybe a little texting. — Hoofy
Just wrapped up here at the Department of Labor. Think I'll take a day off and do some sightseeing before hitting the road to Silicon Valley. — Boo

Hmm, woke up this morning feeling a little strange.... Anyway, join us for the first installment of Financial News on the Move as Boo heads to the nation's capital for a hard-hitting report on the labor market. — Hoofy

America, Hoofy and I are back! Stay tuned over the following months as we travel the country in search of the financial news stories that matter most. This week, I'm headed to Washington DC where I'll uncover the burdens facing America's 'layoff survivors'. — Boo
